The bed smelled of cologne. The elevators are creepy, the gay bar on floor 2 is VERY busy and therefore there's a steady stream of heavily perfumed people running around. If you're perfume allergic: Stay Away. PARKING IS A NIGHTMARE. The lot is too small and if there aren't spots you are directed to other hotel parking lots a good walk away. Add $10/day to the price for parking. The plus side: great to be on this side of waikiki overlooking the zoo. They were willing to negotiate to $100 per room a week from high season. A couple of the rooms may be nice below but stay on the 9th floor or above is our suggestion. The nice gal at the front desk refunded our money graciously. For $10 more per night we moved to the Beachcomber and were MUCH relieved and preferred being able to walk to better food (Moana Surfrider Veranda).

Reviews.Title: “Hated the Waikiki Grand”
Reviews.Author: KellyZ
Reviews.Content: The outside of the htoel looks okay, but the second you get on the elevator things only get worse. We had a decent view if the park, but there was a busy avenue right below the windows. We stayed on the fourth floor and the gay bar two floors down was loud until about 3 am on the weekend. Buses start up early, as well as street cleaners, and traffic in general. Even heard a homeless man pushing his cart by. There was a group of 7 loud, drunk guys outside until 4 in the morning with a prostitute, and someone else got beat up, which brought sirens and more noise. This avenue seemed full of drunks. This is a big deal when there is no air conditioning and the windows must remain open. Do not plan on getting any solid sleep and don't plan on sleeping past 6 am. The bed was cheap, the sheets smelled. I took the bedspread off and walked it down to make sure it was replaced. The lanai was gross, the bathroom was gross, the carpet looked and felt gross. This place is very dirty. It is also VERY overpriced. There are hotels closer to prime areas that are cheaper and MUCH cleaner. The zoo is also nearby, and I could smell faint animal smells. The pullout bed was a bunch of plywood nailed into a frame and a lumpy mattress was on top, with no blankets. At least you'll make yourself go out and do something, because very few people woulod intentionally stay there loger than they have to. I'm not picky, just like to get my money's worth. Stayed in a much better place in 2005, for the same money.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for the price!”
Reviews.Author: aztrvlgrl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Waikiki Grand Hotel from Dec 29-Jan 5, 2006 and were pretty happy with our selection. We booked the room through a vacation rental website and did not realize that it was a hotel that catered to gay and lesbian couples and needless to say, my husband was not too happy when he found out. However, for only $100 a night (during new years) and to be right across the street from the beach, we were EXTREMELY happy with the hotel. Our room was actually a studio condo and was neat and tidy as advertised. We even had a stove, fridge, toaster and dishes, which was extremely nice. We hit the ABC stores multiple times for breakfast and snack foods so we did not have to eat out all the time. (another bonus is the Starbucks right there on the corner) The staff was extremely friendly at the Waikiki Grand and we never had a problem getting beach towels or chairs – they don’t even charge you for them like some of the bigger hotels. It was a simple hotel – no extras, but a good deal for the price. As far as the gay and lesbian scene – yes, there is a bar on the 2nd floor that caters to gay and lesbian couples, but we never felt uncomfortable during our stay. We saw many different types of people staying at the hotel, from younger, straight couples such as ourselves, to retirees, and families. The only negative during our stay was the location of our room. Our room faced the alley and since there are no “real windows” in the room, the noise from the street carried up to our room and we were woken up on a couple of different occasions in the wee-hours of the morning. The hotel is at the end of the Waikiki strip, but in easy walking distance to all of Waikiki’s beaches and shopping. We found many great places to eat and there are PLENTY of places to shop. The hotel is also across the street from the Zoo and Kapiolani Park. For the adventurous souls, you can take a long walk/jog all the way up to the top of Diamond Head for spectacular views. (make sure you do this early in the morning before it gets too hot) We also took the advice of another travler and made reservations at the Top of Waikiki for their sunset dinner - great advice. The food was excellent and the sunset was amazing. Happy traveling!

Reviews.Title: “Better than Expected”
Reviews.Author: HS_hstry_tchr
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were a little leary of staying in this hotel, especially after reading some of the reviews on this site. After calling about room reservations, we were told that they couldn't give us a room number until check-in, but that we did have one of the better rooms. We wound up with room 911, which was wonderful! The view was great from the balcony, over the zoo, out towards diamond head, and right toward the ocean. You also overlook a park where we watched school groups eat and families play. Since he was there on business and I met him there for 3 days, we weren't in the hotel that much, which is how it should be for someone travelling to Hawaii. The room was great -- we had a coffee maker, refrigerator, microwave. The TV was small, but we never turned it on anyway. The room wasn't large, either, but for the two of us, as little as we were there, it was fine. We also realized on the second day that maid service is better if you tip. There was some balcony construction going on in the room above us, but there were signs warning us and encouraging hotel guests to schedule activities out of the hotel during certain hours (again, you're in Hawaii, who's going to be in the hotel all day??). Overall, a much better experience than expected, especially for the reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “They Don't Deilver What They Promise”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: To anyone thinking of staying at this hotel, all I can say is "buyer beware". I was a repeat customer at this hotel and thought that we would try it again. After making an internet reservation though the Waikiki Grand website (they also go by the name of Queen Surf Rentals), we received an email confirmation to stay in Room 911 (one of their top-rated and nicest rooms). My wife and I (yes, we knew that it was gay-friendly, but that doesn't bother us as we're open minded Canadians) were very much looking forward to spending time in Room 911 as it is often described as one of the best in the hotel. When we arrived around 12:30 a.m. of January 23, I was greeted by a security person who not only couldn't find my confirmation, but also had difficulty communicating in simple English. After spending almost half an hour searching around the offices and making phone calls, it was finally discovered that my room was rented out due to "an emergency". Excuse me??!! The whole premise behind a reservation confirmation is to actually hold that room, not rent it out. Instead of enjoying a romantic 2 days in room 911, my wife and I were given room 509. Hardly the same room and quite frankly, a room that I wouldn't let my worst enemy stay in. Dingy, drab, and noisy. The next morning, we were moved to room 1002. Roomier and a nice view from the balcony. But the furniture was dirty and the place overall lacked any of the character, romance, or ambiance that we had looked forward to. Quite frankly, I don't think these people can be trusted. No one ever bothered to contact me to explain why we were not given room 911 or offer any sort of apology or explanation. As far as I'm concerned, they breached the contract that we agreed to.

Reviews.Title: “..but I loved the Mai Tai's”
Reviews.Author: KER_1952
Reviews.Content: As the rooms in this hotel have different individual owners, the standards are also different. We had room 614 which was roomy, clean, good size bathroom, TV, fridge, coffee maker...all the things you would expect. Great view over the zoo to Diamond Head and the beach. Great for gay travellers as the best gay bar in Hawaii (Hula's) is located on the 2nd floor and Queen's beach is just a few minutes walk. Will stay there again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It So Much..... I Bought The Unit !”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed in #1009 (penthouse/roof). It was truly paradise. Unbelievable view of the beach and Diamond Head in one stunning panorama. Tans look great against the white sheets, gentle trade winds blowing through the louvered windows. A quick walk to Waikiki Beach to surf, snorkle, and sun; to Kalakaua Avenue with shops and restaurants, or to Kapialani Park & Zoo. The unit was roomy, no fighting for bathroom (2) and had a kitchenette for making quick snacks, with fridge for cold beer to enjoy on the lanai while watching the sunset. While there I watched movies on the big screen on the beach, saw & bought from the art fair in the park, attended the Spam Festival on Kalakaua. Didn't ever need the car. Next time won't even rent one.....just shuttle down from the airport. Can't say enough about it.....it was an incredible stay!

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here with faimily”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This place is old and run down - OK if you are trying to save a lot of money - but stay next door at the Queen Kapiolani if that is the case. Also, this place caters to those engaging in "alternative" lifestyles - so beware if you are bringing the kids, and you do not want them exposed to this.

Reviews.Title: “Tropical room and setting”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at a wonderful location in the Waikiki area. I have stayed at several locations in Waikiki from Hilton Vacation Village($269) to the Sheraton properties ($185-$374). I have also stayed in several properties away from the beach (4-5 blocks $97-$145) The Waikiki Grand Hotel is a smaller hotel with the best location for your vacation dollars. The room I stayed in (618) was recently upgraded with a Hawaiian/tropical flair. This studio/room was fantastic. It has a view of the City/Diamond Head. The room's decor was similar to other rooms costing $190 or more in the area. The room was immaculate. Imagine awaking to the sounds of the beach life at your door step. The property is just steps from the hottest corner in Waikiki, the beach, Starbucks and great dining. The room and property in general are in great condition and are a great bargin.

Reviews.Title: “Unimpressed”
Reviews.Author: Matt89
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here for 4 nights in May of 2005. Let me start by saying the location is amazing! This is by far, the best aspect of the hotel. Based on the description of the room on the website and other guest reviews, we were expecting much more. We did have a nice visit to Honolulu but just felt the hotel was a little underwhelming. While the staff was not rude, they were not particularly that friendly. Manny however was nice and helpful. I could not help but feel the rooms were slightly dirty. The shower curtain in Room 409 absolutely needs to be changed. I will say that the price of $115 seems quite good for what we received. I think the next time, we will stay at a place a little more upscale. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “My favorite hotel room ever!”
Reviews.Author: cabbagemagic
Reviews.Content: I had a great experience here, during my first visit to Waikiki. I had a city view room, and I didn't feel like I was missing out because I couldn't see the ocean. Our room was very clean, and had much more character than a boring generic hotel. The bamboo bed frame and feather comforter were a nice touch, in addition to the nice amenities in the room such as fridge and coffeemaker. The location was great; there is only one street between the hotel and the beach. I also liked the area much better than some of the other areas of Waikiki. It's at the end of the strip but seemed a close walk to everything. It was awesome to have Hula's bar right downstairs, too. Staying here felt like a treat, and it seemed a real bargain compared to the prices of comparable rooms. I don't get to vacation often, and this place offered exactly what I wanted.

Reviews.Title: “Depends on your room number”
Reviews.Author: azjoe35
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here in 1999. The first room we were assigned was terrible. It was sooooo small that there was no room for our suitcases and the TV sat sideways to the bed. The bed sank in the middle, the so called beach view was by looking at an angle out the window behind the TV. Room also sat just over a bus stop so that was heard all the time as was the early morning soda truck delivery with the loud roll-up doors. I am not one to complain as like most, I don't expect to spend much time in the room. However, I was feeling that I had nowhere nice to escape for rest or if the weather turned bad. We went to the front desk and the next day they were nice enough to get us in a suite on the roof for the same price, which was a 1000% improvement. Much larger, full regrigerator, dining table, microwave, sofa. I rate the help of the staff really high (again that was in 99) Without the first room I would rate it much higher in value. With the risk of that included I must rate it neutral.

Reviews.Title: “Not great”
Reviews.Author: Skryppy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 17 days. The staff was wonderful, but the hotel itself was just "ok". We had problems with noise all night long on one floor. People coming and going and doors slamming. When we said something to the staff, we were told that they were washing clothes. Everynight, I don't think so. So we didn't get much sleep here. The view from the balcony was fabulous but we had to switch rooms half way through due to the longer stay and they were booked up for Pro Bowl. We had no view except the back of a building from here. The pool was not working the whole time and we were not compensated for it in any way. The cleaning was not good iether. As they are owned by other people and just rented out, the cleaning is pretty much up to you. They will make the beds but that is just about it. There is not any restaraunt in this hotel at all and the bar is not what we expected and would not go there again. Would not stay here again unless we have to.

Reviews.Title: “Location and Price=Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Chplhill
Reviews.Content: Have been to Hawai'i 7 times and have stayed anywhere from $75 to $400 plus rooms. The location is the best in Waikiki I think. Ask for an OCEANVIEW room, and one that has been renovated. You have the best view in Honolulu (direct view of the Park and Diamondhead, and across the street from the Park beaches...absolutely one of the best views in Hawaii. I generally do not care for Honolulu, but when I have a day or two, I will stay here. YOU NEED TO CALL IN ADVANCE AND RESERVE YOUR PARKING WITH THE HOTEL AS IT IS LIMITED. There is a gay bar on the 2nd floor, that is filled with locals. I don't think that straight families would have any issues, (I didn't) but if you are a homophobe stay elsewhere. Also, you need to know that a portion of this is apartments for 20 somethings. That is why you should BE SURE to request an oceanview room. These are the true hotel rooms. The location can absolutely NOT be beat. If you have teen children who want to roam, (WITHOUT YOU) the main drag of Waikiki is here, and the beach, park, zoo, and aquarium are right across the street. Would recommend this hotel and will be staying here again. The rooms are small. Don't expect a room the size of a Hampton Inn or a business hotel. This is Hawai'i. Rooms at at a premium, and if you want a very elaborate room, go elsewhere....and expect to pay a lot more. Rooms hold 2 people comfortably...any more than that you would be pushing it. If you want to go to the beach and roam around Waikiki, then this is perfect for you.

Reviews.Title: “Fantasitc location! Great price, Best views”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed in a hotel that I enjoyed and I felt I would share this hotel jewel for anyone wanting affordable lodging in Waikiki with spectacular views. The location can't be beat. It is in the the recently renovated Waikiki Grand. I strongly recommend staying in unit 911. Being on a higher floor, you had no street nosies, just supurb scenery. It had breathtaking views of the Ocean and Diamond head. It is the last building near the corner of Kalakaua and Kapahulu, so you have an unobstructed view from your bed and lanai overlooking the lush greenness of Kapiolani park and you can have a beautiful view of the beach from this room. I can't say enough about this view because it has to be one of the best in Waikiki. The beach across the street is Queen's surf beach and the city has just completed new landscaping and paving so there is a beautiful new promenade to walk along . Also on weekends they have Free movies on the beach there. They set up a 50 foot screen and everyone gathers on the beach and buys food from the stands located temporarily for the show. You can even watch the movies from the Lanai of the room I was in. The 24 hour fitness facility is just around the corner on Kalakaua. So entertainment, shopping, movies, botanic gardens, aquarium, zoo are all within a 15 minute walk! There is a Denny's and Starbuck's on the corner, it is also where the bus from the airport stops. The Lyon Arboretum and its rainforest palm collection is a 5 minute bus ride away. You can stay at the Queens surf and have no need for a car rental. But if you do want to rent a car and explore the other parts of this beautiful island, there is parking underground here. That is very important because parking spaces are very rare in Waikiki and so it is difficult to find a space if it isn't provided and they ticket and tow readily in Waikiki. The Queens surf is a vacation rentals type of lodging.. These units are in the Waikiki Grand hotel and vary in size, view and price. Most of the units have been remodeled and have gorgeous limestone floors with track lighting, new tropical furniture, crown moldings and look very fresh and upscale. They all come with a refrigerator, coffee maker, beautiful duvet covered beds that are changed daily! The rooms are spotless!! There is a new fantastic laundry facility in the basement with a free color TV and large folding areas. The ocean is across the street. There is also an open air limestone floored lobby and it is a great place to sit and watch people. Besides from the best location and best view, friendly service and spotless rooms, the thing that makes this place outstanding is the price. The prices vary depending on how long you are staying, if you need a full kitchen, or want that million dollar view of the extinct diamond head looming over the lush tropical greenness of the zoo and Kapiolani park. Rooms go for between $60-$125/night. That is incredible! Just explain to one of the people at the front desk your needs, (Liz is great) if you are on a budget or whether you want to go all out and they will make sure that you get a wonderful room at the absolute BEST value. For the view, cleanliness, location, facilities, and price it is unbeatable. I've had friends that have been back twice and with those prices were able to stay longer the second time and really felt at home, comfortable, beautiful views, everything a convenient short walk away. It made for a very enjoyable vacation. With all the upgrading and new landscaping the city has provided to the nearby area, this part of Honolulu has become wonderful. Perfect for sunning, swimming, socializing and shopping. It is not grass-shack-isolated-tropical luxuriance, but it is big city fun, excitement, activities, cleanliness, safe friendly and Great prices.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: GayTwosome
Reviews.Content: First, re one of the earlier reviews...Queens' Surf (in the Waikiki Grand building) is NOT the only gay-owned property in the neighborhood. However, it is the only one (in my opinion) with the best location. The check-in process at the front desk was the same as any hotel with friendly and courtesy service. But do not consider booking anything but an ocean-view room, which actually faces the park more than the ocean. The view from you balcony of Diamond Head every morning as you have coffee and the view of the surfers returning to their cars in the evening is well worth the small difference in price from the city view room. The imaculately clean and white studio we had (#414) was perfect with a tidy kitchenette with every possible item of utensils, dinnerware and cookware...plus a coffee pot and microwave and fridge. We do agree with the earlier review that there is some noise from the elevator, but that happens in any hotel. We requested, and received promptly from the front desk, a small fan which we turned on at night to mask outside noise. It worked perfectly and our sleep in the very comfortable bed was undisturbed until the sun started streaming in the next morning. Hulas, the largest gay bar in town, was on the second floor but the music from the club never disturbed us. In fact, we could not hear it even when we were on the balcony. And it was very convenient to pop in for a drink or a cruise whenever we wished. Queens' Surf beach is a 5-minute walk away and the execellent and very-gay-friendly W Hotel bar is a 10-minute walk. Situated on the far East end of the the main drag in Waikiki, the property is out of the press of the main tourist trade. Whenever you are ready to head to the beach, the front desk hands out large towels and beach chairs. They are yours for the day free of charge. There is also a large and recently renovated coin laundry room in the basement with new washers and dryers that have digital timers, plus a large flat-screen TV to help pass the time. This property was the perfect place to relax, play, or just enjoy the best of the beach and the city. We will be back every February for at least a week.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't recommend”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a great location and the price is good. The front desk staff are very friendly but completely incompetent. The maid service is terrible. If you want good service and a clean room do not stay here.
